posts.content:
If I am correct then :

DC = 10 + spell level + ability modifier + feat modifier

Spell level : Wail of the Banshee level 9 spell

Ability modifier : 18 start, all stat bonuses to Int (+20), + 12 item bonus, + 2 RDD bonus, 10 Gr. Int feats = 52.

Feat modifier : Epic Spell Focus + 6

spell focus +2
gr. sf +4
e sf +6

Highest Int = 18 + 10 + 10 = 38 + 12 = 50 (RDD + 2) = 52.  Ability Modifier +26

Wail of the Banshee - + 9

10 + 9 + 26 + 6 = 51

So a Wizard with at least 9 levels of RDD, Epic Spell Focus Necromancy and all 10 Great Int feats with a starting Int of 18 will hit a final DC of 51, is that the highest?

Or am I missing something?

posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content: Modifier is half the amount above 10. So 52 Int gives (52-10)/2 = 21 ability modifier. The DC will be 46, one higher than the "normal" maximum. That said, I believe the highest save-or-die spell DC is against a DC 48 Implosion, which has a built-in +3DC.

Thanks.

I forgot that stat bonus starts above 10.
